title: Traceability and Recall
description: Comprehensive traceability system enabling one-step-back, one-step-forward tracking and effective recall procedures including mock recall testing

requirements.text: Is there a document that indicates how the company product tracking system works, thereby enabling trace back and trace forward to occur in the event of a potential recall issue?
mandatoryStatements: Traceability system is documented describing how tracking works
System enables trace back to incoming materials and suppliers
System enables trace forward to customers and distribution
Lot or batch coding system is defined
Record linkages that enable traceability are specified
System covers all products, ingredients, and packaging materials
Timeframe for completing traceback/trace forward is defined
System supports one-step-back, one-step-forward traceability minimum
Electronic or manual tracking methods are described
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of traceability system documentation, semi-annual mock recall testing
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that traceability records are being created, immediate verification when lot coding changes

requirements.text: Does the organization have a documented recall program including procedures, recall team roles and contact details, external contact listings, requirement for recall effectiveness checks, explanation of different recall classes and handling of recalled product?
mandatoryStatements: Recall program is documented with comprehensive procedures
Recall team members are identified with roles and responsibilities
Current contact information for recall team members is maintained
External contact list includes customers, suppliers, regulators, and media contacts
Recall initiation criteria and decision-making process are defined
Recall classification system (Class I, II, III or equivalent) is explained
Procedures for different recall classes are specified
Customer notification procedures and templates are included
Product retrieval and segregation procedures are defined
Recall effectiveness check methods are described
Disposition of recalled product (destruction, rework, return) is specified
Public communication and media response procedures are included
Recall closure and reporting requirements are defined
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of recall program for completeness and accuracy of contact information, semi-annual mock recall exercises
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification of recall team contact information, immediate update when personnel changes affect recall team

requirements.text: Is testing of recall procedures (including traceback) performed and documented at least every six months, and the company can demonstrate the ability to trace materials (one step forward, one step back) effectively?
mandatoryStatements: Mock recall exercises are conducted at least every six months
Mock recall includes traceback to suppliers/ingredients
Mock recall includes trace forward to customers/distribution
Exercise demonstrates one-step-back, one-step-forward capability minimum
Time required to complete traceback and trace forward is documented
Mock recall report documents exercise date, product selected, and results
Gaps or deficiencies identified during exercise are documented
Corrective actions to improve traceability or recall system are implemented
Effectiveness of traceback and trace forward is evaluated
Mock recall involves key recall team members
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of mock recall records, verification that exercises are conducted semi-annually as required
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Semi-annual mock recall exercises conducted on schedule, immediate follow-up on identified gaps, quarterly verification of corrective action implementation

capaInject: If traceability system fails during mock recall: immediate investigation, implement improvements within 30 days, conduct follow-up mock recall to verify effectiveness
If traceback or trace forward takes excessive time: analyze bottlenecks, improve record systems or lot coding, reduce traceback time to acceptable level (typically 2-4 hours)
If recall team contact information is outdated: update immediately, implement quarterly verification process
If mock recall not conducted semi-annually: conduct overdue exercise immediately, investigate scheduling failure, implement calendar reminders
If actual recall occurs: activate recall program immediately, document all actions, conduct post-recall review within 30 days, implement improvements identified
traceabilityInject: Traceability system must link raw materials to finished products through production records
Lot codes must be traceable to production dates, lines, and personnel
Receiving records must be traceable to supplier lots and delivery dates
Shipping records must be traceable to customer orders and delivery dates
Mock recall records must trace the complete path from supplier through production to customer
All traceability records must be maintained for minimum 24 months or product shelf life plus 6 months
